title: GRAP 4 lifted: Delhi schools resume normal classes for 6-9 & 11; hybrid for rest
description: Delhi schools have ended hybrid learning and resumed normal physical classes for students of Classes 6 to 9 and 11 after GRAP 4 measures were lifted. The Directorate of Education issued directions to government and private schools to implement the change immediately. The decision followed an improvement in air quality, with authorities continuing GRAP stages 1 to 3 while monitoring conditions closely across the capital.

Beijing insists its defence policy is misrepresented and aims to sow discord. China maintains its border situation with India is stable and seeks to advance a sound bilateral relationship, while dismissing US claims as biased and confrontational.

Delhi pvt schools must form fee regulation committees by Jan 10: What parents should know
description: Delhi’s Directorate of Education has fixed January 10 as the deadline for private schools to form fee regulation committees for the 2025–26 academic year. Under the new process, schools must place their proposed charges before these committees—where parents and teachers are represented—by January 25. Decisions must follow within 30 days, shifting fee discussions from sudden announcements to a defined, time-bound process that parents can track.

title: Karisma Kapoor, Sunjay Kapur’s kids wear late father’s jersey on Christmas
description: Karisma Kapoor's children, Samaira and Kiaan, honored their late father, industrialist Sunjay Kapur, on their first Christmas without him by wearing jerseys from his Aureus Polo team. This poignant gesture follows the Delhi High Court concluding proceedings in a Rs 30,000 crore estate dispute involving Sunjay's will and his widowed wife, Priya Sachdev.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Another Hindu man lynched; cops link it to extortion bid
description: Bangladesh faces renewed criticism after a second lynching, this time of Amrit Mondal, just days after worker Dipu Chandra Das was killed. Mondal was allegedly beaten to death by villagers after demanding extortion money. These incidents highlight growing concerns over the safety of minority communities amidst ongoing unrest.

In classrooms, emotional strain is outpacing academic questions: Reality teachers can't ignore
description: Teachers are increasingly hearing anxiety and emotional fatigue instead of academic doubts in classrooms. The Student Sync Index 2026 reveals that student stress is constant, with mental health concerns now outweighing academic pressure. While teachers recognise this shift and respond with empathy, the roots of stress are often externalised, leaving school systems largely unchanged.

IndiGo cancels 67 flights; bad weather, operational reasons cited
description: IndiGo is dealing with another wave of disruptions, canceling 67 flights due to weather and operational issues, impacting key airports. This comes as the airline operates under DGCA scrutiny following earlier mass cancellations linked to new pilot rest rules. The aviation regulator's panel is investigating, with a report on IndiGo's operational woes expected soon.

'Don't comment, post views': Army issues policy on use of social media apps
description: The Army has unveiled new social media guidelines for its personnel. While platforms like Instagram and YouTube are restricted to viewing and information gathering, users can share unclassified general information on messaging apps like WhatsApp and Signal with known contacts. LinkedIn is permitted for professional networking and job seeking purposes only.

title: Dhurandhar surpasses Animal at worldwide box office; can Ranbir Kapoor’s film get redemption with Japan release?
Shreyas Iyer injury update: 31-yr-old has 1st batting session since injury
description: India's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has begun batting practice sessions post-injury in Mumbai, showing no discomfort. The 31-year-old is now heading to the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru for further assessment. While a return date remains uncertain, Iyer is aiming for the Vijay Hazare Trophy, with clarity expected after assessment at the CoE.

title: Political scorecard in 2025: Top 10 winners and losers of this year
description: 2025 saw political shifts with Nitish Kumar retaining power in Bihar and Siddaramaiah navigating a leadership tussle. While Nitin Nabin and Chirag Paswan rose, the Congress faced defeats and internal strife. Arvind Kejriwal's AAP lost Delhi, and Prashant Kishor's political venture faltered, highlighting power's dynamic nature.

VHT: Rohit stops young fan from touching his feet; video goes viral
description: Rohit Sharma won hearts after stopping a young fan from touching his feet following Mumbai’s Vijay Hazare Trophy opener. He then starred with the bat, smashing 155 off 94 balls as Mumbai beat Sikkim by eight wickets in Jaipur. Rohit’s knock included his fastest-ever List A century and ensured a dominant win.

title: TikTok US operations deal: China may have a 'surprise' for America
description: TikTok has struck a deal to spin off its US operations into a new joint venture with American investors, set to launch January 22. This move aims to avert a nationwide ban, with the new entity responsible for US data, algorithms, and content moderation. China has expressed hopes for a fair business environment for its companies in the US.

description: A car adorned with a "Happy Chanukah" sign was deliberately set ablaze in Melbourne, prompting an investigation into a potential antisemitic attack. While no injuries were reported, the incident has heightened fears within the Jewish community, following a recent mass shooting at a Hanukkah festival.

Candidates 2026: 'Praggnanandhaa is third favourite' - World No. 1 Carlsen
description: World No. 1 and five-time World Champion Magnus Carlsen has named Americans Hikaru Nakamura and Fabiano Caruana as favourites for the 2026 Candidates, with India’s R Praggnanandhaa as the third contender. Praggnanandhaa is the only Indian among eight players competing to challenge World Champion D Gukesh. The tournament starts on March 28 in Cyprus.

Rich Indians rush to transfer money abroad as rupee falls, banks expand regulations
description: Indian banks are intensifying scrutiny on overseas money transfers, demanding detailed proof of fund origins from individuals and businesses. This heightened caution, particularly for remittances from NRO accounts, arises amid the rupee's slide and increased customer urgency to move funds abroad, leading to compliance hurdles.

CBSE in 2025: A look back at the changes set to reshape board exams
description: CBSE will introduce wide-ranging reforms from the 2025–26 session, reshaping exams, curriculum, and student support. Class 10 board exams will become biannual from 2026, allowing score improvement. APAAR ID linkage is now mandatory for Classes 9–12. Exam fees have increased, while syllabi align with NCF 2023. New career guidance, mental health counselling models, and an AI-powered digital experience centre aim to reduce stress and modernise learning for students, parents, and schools nationwide and abroad too.

description: England's Ashes tour faces off-field controversy after a mid-series break. Former captain Michael Vaughan urges restraint, stating the issue stems from cricket's ingrained drinking culture. He argues that players relaxing on days off often engage in similar behaviour. Vaughan believes this is a systemic problem across several cricketing nations, not an individual failing.

description: Union minister Nitin Gadkari recounted meeting Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh hours before his assassination in Tehran. Gadkari, was in Iran, attending presidential swearing-in, and was informed of Haniyeh's death early next morning. The incident highlighted the growing role of technology in modern conflict and national security.

description: A 45-year-old computer teacher, Rau Danish Ali, was fatally shot by two masked assailants on a two-wheeler while taking an evening walk on the AMU campus. The attackers fled the scene after firing at close range. Police are investigating the incident, with the family suggesting the victim may have known his attackers.

H-1B in age of social media vetting: When tweets meet immigration rules for global talent
description: America’s H-1B visa process has picked up a new gatekeeper: your social media. A December 2025 State Department update asks H-1B applicants and H-4 dependants to keep their accounts public during visa processing, widening a review earlier used for student visas. For skilled workers, the shift is subtle but real—credentials still matter, but so does your digital footprint, and how it might be read.

'Didn't want to miss ...': How B'luru techie plotted wife's murder; chilling details emerge
description: A 39-year-old bank manager was allegedly murdered by her estranged software engineer husband, Balamurugan, who had planned the killing for months. He reportedly procured an illegal pistol and carried a knife as a backup, later surrendering to police and showing no remorse. The couple had a troubled marriage marked by alleged abuse.

title: MDMA, LSD, ecstasy pills: Woman techie & boyfriend held for selling high-end drugs
description: Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing arrested four individuals, including three alleged drug peddlers, in a drug network bust. Officials seized a significant quantity of drugs, including OG, MDMA, LSD blots, and ecstasy pills, valued at over Rs 3 lakh. The operation revealed a sophisticated network involving online procurement and cryptocurrency payments.

title: Nancy Kerrigan net worth: How the skating legend built wealth beyond ice
description: Nancy Kerrigan, a two-time Olympic medalist and former U.S. Champion, is celebrated for her resilience.  Following a shocking attack before the 1994 Olympics, she made a remarkable comeback, winning a silver medal.  Her post-competitive career includes ice shows, TV appearances, and endorsements, contributing to an estimated net worth of $10 million.

title: iRobot Bankruptcy: Co-founder explains reason; Blames Chinese rivals, Amazon deal block
description: iRobot, famed for its Roomba vacuums, has filed for bankruptcy, with former CEO Colin Angle citing fierce competition from Chinese firms. He highlighted how these rivals leveraged China's domestic market and government support, creating an uneven playing field.  The failed Amazon acquisition further complicated iRobot's struggles, ultimately impacting the broader consumer robotics sector.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
description: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.
